thread.title: ‘Hunger Games’ competitors to make pitches

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: ‘Hunger Games’ competitors to make pitches
text:
ALBANY – The state’s 10 regional councils seeking about $750 million in state aid for hometown projects and battling for a piece of a $1.5 billion competitive fund will make their pitch to state officials next week. Seven of the 10 regional councils are in the hunt for one of the three $500 million awards that have been named the “Hunger Games” competition for the popular novels and books.
Three regions — New York City, Long Island and Buffalo — aren’t eligible for the contest, but can get a piece of the roughly $750 million that is doled out each year from 11 state agencies through the council awards, which will be announced in December.
The councils will present their plans from Tuesday, Oct. 20, through Thursday, Oct. 22, to a state panel. The state has allocated nearly $3 billion for about 3,100 projects since Gov. Andrew Cuomo established the councils in 2011.
“This year’s competition is sure to continue to strengthen and diversify New York’s economic landscape,” Howard Zemsky, Empire State Development president, said in a statement.
Each council will have 45 minutes to present its plans to the so-called “Strategic Implementation Assessment Team.”
“The locally-led and driven Regional Economic Development Council process has been instrumental in spurring investment and creating jobs throughout New York State, reinforcing Governor Cuomo’s successful vision of a bottom-up competitive approach for economic growth,” Secretary of State Cesar Perales, who heads the team, said in a statement.
To limit the disparity between winners and losers, Cuomo is giving more aid to the regions that don’t win one of the three $500 million awards.
The remaining seven regional councils will split the $750 million in available funding, but each region would get between $90 million and $105 million, which is more than they had received in previous years.
Twitter: @GannettAlbany
Here’s the council’s presentation schedule:
Tuesday, October 20, 2015
9:30 a.m. Mid-Hudson Presentation
11:45 a.m. Capital Region Presentation
3:00 p.m. Southern Tier Presentation
Wednesday, October 21, 2015
9:00 a.m. Mohawk Valley Presentation
11:15 a.m. North Country Presentation
1:30 p.m. Finger Lakes Presentation
3:45 p.m. Central NY Presentation
Thursday, October 22, 2015
9:30 a.m. Western NY Presentation
11:45 a.m. New York City Presentation
2:00 p.m. Long Island Presentation
